K-state is right by an army base and there are many people from the army walking around so it feels safer.
I have not got into the greek life.
Each Major offers a few different clubs that you can get into to get more experience for your feed by taking field trips or just meeting people that are already in your field of study.
Its great for anyone that wants a big campus but not a huge town to go with it. Great for business, Engineers, and Ag students.
The football games are fun.
K-state offers a lot of opportunities and great schooling and it doesn't cost as much as a lot of other Universities.
There are many on campus activities set up by the school as well as shopping malls, skating rings close by, and Aggie Vill is a great place to hang out.
They have excellent friendly cooks that serve a variety of great food.
The dorms mostly nice four person sweets.
At K-State they try teaching you everything you need to know to succeed in the job market and what to expect.
Attend extra activities and stay involved.
K-State is a good sized school that works hard to have activities for the students. Their business program offers a unique program that allows you to learn real life problems.
pageTitle: Kansas State University (K-State) Reviews: Student Reviews and Ratings | Cappex
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {443646=April fool. St. Patrick's Day. Homecoming, 44802=Scholarships are available for pretty much every activity that you're willing to get involved in (including Physics club), but you have to make sure to specifically mention the groups that you're involved in when you meet with your financial aid advisor. Make sure to pay the dorm down-payment, which is either $400 or $500 and is due around the same time that you fill out the housing contract, as early as you can. Waiting until May (when you're planning on moving into dorms in August) can result in you being placed in temporary housing, which means you are stuck wherever housing is available and then you'll receive an email anywhere from three days to four months after moving telling you that you have two days to pack and move everything to another room. Freshman year is generally the best time to take the off-the-wall classes, because once you get into your major specific classes, depending on your field of study, you could run into a bit of a time crunch. Should you have any difficulty with learning material for a specific class, K-State offers free tutoring to students throughout the day at the dining centers. More information can be found online or at the entrances to the dining halls. It is possible to learn a ton, take demanding classes, have a strong GPA, and still have a social life, you just have to be willing to put in the effort and not be afraid to ask for help when you need it., 711722=Make sure to apply for admission early. Fill out the admission and scholarship application before November 1st and take the ACT before your senior year. Also, visit campus on specialized student days. The campus isn't too big and everyone is very friendly., 296967=No matter what your major is or is going to be, get to know the students and professors in your classes and don't be afraid to ask for help. That's what office hours are for. There are a ton of tutoring opportunities available for almost every subject. You just have to utilize them. And no matter how cold it is outside in December, go to class!, 816308=The campus safety at Kansas State University is one of the best. At night there are police that patrol the campus, and there are emergency phone call booths on every side walk. It is so safe at KSU that I have left my car running in the parking lot to warm it up when it's cold outside. Is there crime, yes, but nothing major. The biggest crime that happens on campus is somebody's bicycle was stolen because they did not lock it up. Even at 4 o'clock in the morning there are always students walking back from a late night study session or finishing a project. If feel extremely safe when I am on campus at K-State., 579381=There are so many safety precautions in place; even at 3:00 in the morning I feel safe on campus., 883641=© 2015, Cappex.com, LLC}

textAfterTable: Login to rate or flag the reviews Sara from Derby, KS 08/12/2009 Reviewer is A current student here. 14 out of 14 people found this review useful. 3 of 203 Categories Comments Great for these types of students Friendly Wants to get involved Athletes K-state has a well rounded university that just about everyone can find something they are passionate about. Tips for prospective students Get involved! Meeting new people is part of the college experience and it also helps to make connections for a future job down the road. Also, stay in the Dorms at least one year. Everyone there is usually new and wanting to make friends. The Dorms also have several activities to do. Bang for the buck Paying tuition is never fun but compared to other universities around the country k-state is pretty reasonably priced and the experience and people you meet are worth every penny. Am enjoying being here I
